debs15.dkg_storm

Class DKGStorm

  • java.lang.Object
    • debs15.dkg_storm.DKGStorm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    backtype.storm.grouping.CustomStreamGrouping, Serializable

    public class DKGStorm
extends Object
implements backtype.storm.grouping.CustomStreamGrouping, Serializable
    Author:
    Nicolo Rivetti This class implements the CustomStreamGrouping interface offered by the Apache Storm API This implementation leverages the Distribution-Aaare Key Grouping (DKG) algorithm
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • DKGStorm

        public DKGStorm(double theta,
        double factor,
        int learningLenght,
        IKey key,
        double epsilonFactor)
        Parameters:
        theta - double value in (0,1], heavy hitter threshold, i.e., all keys with an empirical probability larger than or equal to theta belong to the heavy hitter set.
        factor - double value >=1, set the number of buckets of sparse items to factor * k (number of available instances).
        learningLenght - number of tuples that will be used to learn the key value distribution (these tuples are discarded).
        key - An instance of an implementation of the IKey interface, returning an integer value representing the key, through which the operator state is partitioned, associated with each tuple of the stream.
        epsilonFactor - defines the ration between the Space Saving's Heavy Hitter threshold theta and precision parameter epsilon: epsilon = theta / epsilonFactor.

      • DKGStorm

        public DKGStorm(double theta,
        double factor,
        int learningLenght,
        IKey key)
        Parameters:
        theta - double value in (0,1], heavy hitter threshold, i.e., all keys with an empirical probability larger than or equal to theta belong to the heavy hitter set.
        factor - double value >=1, set the number of buckets of sparse items to factor * k (number of available instances).
        learningLenght - number of tuples that will be used to learn the key value distribution (these tuples are discarded).
        key - An instance of an implementation of the IKey interface, returning an integer value representing the key, through which the operator state is partitioned, associated with each tuple of the stream.
